metadata.title: CVE-2017-7109 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11 isaffected. Safari before 11 is affected. iCloud before 7.0 on Windows isaffected. iTunes before 12.7 on Windows is affected. tvOS before 11 isaffected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. A cross-site scripting(XSS) vulnerability allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web scriptor HTML via crafted web content that incorrectly interacts with theApplication Cache policy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7109` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.18.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.18.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.18.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
webkit2gtk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.0-2').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
